html.p: Proposition (A). If [mathjaxinline]\dim V = n < \infty[/mathjaxinline], and [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] is any subspace of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline], then any linearly independent list of vectors in [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] can be extended to form a basis of [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline].

Proposition. If [mathjaxinline]\dim V = n[/mathjaxinline], then any linearly independent list of vectors in [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] has at most [mathjaxinline]n[/mathjaxinline] vectors. Any linearly independent list of vectors in [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] that has exactly [mathjaxinline]n[/mathjaxinline] vectors must be a basis of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline].

Proposition. If [mathjaxinline]\dim V = n[/mathjaxinline], then any subspace [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] has dimension at most [mathjaxinline]n[/mathjaxinline]. If [mathjaxinline]\dim W = n[/mathjaxinline], then [mathjaxinline]W = V[/mathjaxinline].
Proposition (B). Any finite list of vectors that spans a vector space [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] contains a basis of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline].

Proposition. If [mathjaxinline]\dim V = n[/mathjaxinline], then any list of vectors that spans [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] has at least [mathjaxinline]n[/mathjaxinline] vectors. Any list of vectors that spans [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] that has exactly [mathjaxinline]n[/mathjaxinline] vectors must be a basis of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline].
